page.title: 05LOCAL GOVERNMENT - ARNCLIFFE
page.content: Like the other villages in Littondale, Arncliffe has its own Parish Meeting. The meeting elects a Chairman and Secretary. All those on the electoral roll of the village are entitled to attend and vote. Others, such as those owning holiday cottages, may attend but not vote. The Meeting has a limited amount of money at its disposal. This money comes from the letting of parish land. Whilst the Meeting can discuss and make decisions on matters of village interest, major decisions are taken by Craven District Council, the Yorkshire Dales National Park (especially on planning matters), and North Yorkshire County Council. For many years the area has been in a Pariamentary constituency which has returned a Conservative Member of Parliament.
